edu.ucla.sspace.vector

Class AbstractDoubleVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.vector.AbstractVector<Double>
      • edu.ucla.sspace.vector.AbstractDoubleVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DoubleVector, Vector<Double>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompactSparseVector, DenseVector

    public abstract class AbstractDoubleVector
extends AbstractVector<Double>
implements DoubleVector
    An abstract base class that provides default implementations of common methods in DoubleVector. DoubleVector implementations need only implement Vector.length() and DoubleVector.get(int) functionality to be read-only vectors.

      Returns the hash code as the sum of the vectors elements, normalized to an int.

      • toArray

        public double[] toArray()
        Returns a double array representing this vector. The returned array will be "safe" in that no changes to the array will be reflected in the vector, and likewise for changes to to the vector. The caller is thus free to modify the returned array.
        Specified by:
        toArray in interface DoubleVector
        Returns:
        a double array of this vector.
